Explicit Slack Gap Signal

Explicit labour market slack: UNRATE minus NROU.

As of Unknown

Gemini Summary

Signal Summary:

  • The Explicit Slack Gap Signal indicates a NEUTRAL labor market as of 2025-07-31, with the unemployment rate at 4.2% and the natural rate of unemployment at 4.315608% (1). This signifies that labor market slack is currently stable with a slight tightness but within the neutral zone.
  • Conviction Band: Medium | Interpretation Confidence: Medium | Internal Conflict Flag: No.

Key Dynamics:

  • The primary quantitative drivers are the Unemployment Rate (UNRATE) and the Natural Rate of Unemployment (NROU) (1). The current slack gap is -0.115608 percentage points.
  • Momentum for the slack gap is STABLE, with a 3-month change of +0.106065 percentage points, indicating no significant shift in dynamics (1).
  • Conditional Invalidation: The signal would reverse to a Slackening regime if the `SlackGap_pp` increases to or above +0.50 percentage points (1).

Scenario Balance:

  • Base Case dominant: The labor market will likely remain in a neutral slack position, with the unemployment rate hovering close to the natural rate of unemployment.
  • Upside secondary: Stronger economic growth could reduce the unemployment rate further, pushing the slack gap into a Tight regime.
  • Downside residual: An economic slowdown could increase the unemployment rate, widening the slack gap towards a Slackening regime.

Time Horizon & Aggregation:

  • Time Horizon: Cyclical (months). This signal provides a medium-term view of labor market tightness or slack.
  • Aggregation Weight Hint: Medium. It is a core input for assessing the labor market's health and its implications for monetary policy.

Macro Relevance:

  • Macro dimension informed: Slack (1).
  • Cycle position: This signal reflects the current capacity utilization of the labor market, helping to identify mid-to-late cycle dynamics or early signs of a slowdown.
  • Typical interaction with other macro signals: Often used in Fed reaction-function models and correlates with inflation signals (tight markets imply wage pressures) and overall growth indicators (1).

Data & References:

  • Civilian Unemployment Rate (UNRATE) at 4.2% (latest: 2025-07-31) (1).
  • Natural Rate of Unemployment (NROU) at 4.315608% (latest: 2025-07-31) (1).
  • The `SlackGap_pp` of -0.115608 pp and its 3-month change are most influential.
  • Additional public datasets: U-6 Underemployment Rate (2) and Labour Force Participation Rate (3) would enhance depth and reliability.
